triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the central question of how biodiversity relates to ecosystem stability, examining species diversity as a key factor.

triples.name: Ecological stability
triples.relevance: Core concept that the paper investigates, resolving the diversity-stability debate through novel mathematical models.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper models competitive interactions among populations with sublinear growth patterns.

triples.name: Logistic function
triples.relevance: Logistic growth is contrasted with the novel sublinear growth model proposed in the paper.

triples.name: Power law
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that growth scales as a sublinear power law with biomass as the novel mechanism for stability.

triples.name: Competitive exclusion principle
triples.relevance: The paper explains how sublinear growth prevents competitive exclusion, allowing multiple species to coexist.

triples.name: Macroecology
triples.relevance: The paper predicts large-scale macroecological patterns emerging from the sublinear growth model.

triples.name: Ontogeny
triples.relevance: Population self-regulation is described as analogous to individual ontogeny (development).
